item.title: A root of the tree might be lifting slabs and concrete board/cement from the pavement, 24th September
item.description:
Someone from the council (a contractor maybe) has marked the area just outside my house of 3 Crisden Cottages, Stanley Way, Orpington, BR5 2HE recently. Previously a similar repair has taken place. Didn’t last long before slabs boarder and cement were broken/moved out of place. I do need the repairer’s advice in order to make a decision wether the tree needs to be removed or just cutting down the roots would be a good solution. I think this together with maybe underground water/soul move is causing the issue. Please do let me know so we can repair the area in a way that it can at least last longer. Best regards Nick

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Stanley Way, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This bin needs emptying regularly, 24th September
item.description:
This commercial bin and others in Fletching Rd need more regular emptying. Rubbish is spewing out of them and attracting vermin. The rest of Fletching Rd is covered in rubbish too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Walm Lane, corner Cricklewood Broadway NW2, 24th September
item.description:
The tree has been felled, but new growth is abundant, obstructing the pavement. The brick surround has always been an unpleasant feature of this corner. The brick wall is broken, the tree has gone - please remove the lot! Other obstructions have been installed too close to this, leaving little room for pedestrians

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walm Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet
